message_1: I apologize, but I cannot generate numerical problems related to deontic logic as it is a philosophical branch of logic that deals with obligations, permissions, and prohibitions. It does not involve numerical calculations or equations. Instead, it deals with the relationship between a normative statement (e.g. "One ought/ought not to do X") and the world described by that statement. If you have any other questions related to deontic logic, I would be happy to assist you.
message_2: Thank you for the information about deontic logic. If you have any mathematical problems or questions related to other areas of mathematics, please feel free to ask, and I will be happy to help.
